channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree hit by truck, 8th September
item.description:
Large tree hit by truck and lots of debris fallen into road, with possible damage to adjacent building which is being redeveloped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Hill Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black notice cable ties on streetlight hitting peoples faces, 8th September
item.description:
There are a couple of thick black cable ties on a streetlight where there used to be notices put up by the council. The notices have been removed but the cable ties remain on the streetlight outside number 28 and 30 Rodwell Road. The cable ties hit people in the eyes / face. Please can these be removed properly?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Rodwell Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cement Fiber Roof Sheets (may contain asbestos!), 8th September
item.description:
Corrugated cement fibre roof sheets have been fly-tipped by the entrance to the park (allotments access road). These sheets may contain asbestos. Please remove them as soon as possible due to the environmental hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous Dumping, 8th September
item.description:
Yet again the raised beds are being used to dump cans, bottles, glass, boxes plastic bags etc. This area is being increasingly used to dump rubbish and packaging. It needs to be cleared daily as pedestrians think it’s ok to throw their rubbish into the bushes and grasses when they see rubbish already in there. The road sweeper doesn’t clear the beds or collect the rubbish from the beds. Why?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the new mini-roadabout at the junction of Southend Rd, Park Rd and Foxgrove Rd, Beckenham the white paint road markings are about 50% worn out, especially the Southend Rd toucan crossing., 8th September
item.description:
At the new mini-roadabout at the junction of Southend Rd, Park Rd and Foxgrove Rd, Beckenham the white paint road markings are about 50% worn out, especially the Southend Rd toucan crossing. The roundabout was only installed less than a year ago. It looks like ordinary household paint has been used instead of heavy duty poured white tarmac. Please re-mark the many road markings and investigate why such an inappropriate paint was used, which will now result in extra materials and labour cost and traffic disruption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light out in front of 9 Bell Yard, 8th September
item.description:
Hello, there is a light out in front of 9 Bell Yard. This makes the street quite dark at night. Please fix this as some people have been using this lack of light to their advantage to mug people in the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Bell Yard, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
